identity.label: RSI (Relative Strength Index)
identity.blurb: A momentum oscillator that ranges between 0 and 100 to describe the balance of advances vs. declines.
identity.longSummary: RSI compares the magnitude of recent gains to recent losses over a lookback window, mapping the relationship onto a bounded 0–100 scale. Values above the midline suggest bullish pressure; below the midline suggest bearish pressure. Pushes toward overbought/oversold often precede mean reversion, while midline holds and reclaimed levels often align with trend continuation. RSI is commonly paired with a simple trend filter for clarity.
identity.mathSummary: RSI = 100 − (100 / (1 + RS)), where RS = AvgGain / AvgLoss over N periods.

tooltips._indicator: RSI maps the balance of advances vs. declines onto a 0–100 scale. Midline acts as a momentum bias; pushes to extremes often revert.
tooltips.source: Price field used to compute changes.
tooltips.overbought: Upper threshold often used to spot stretched momentum.
tooltips.oversold: Lower threshold often used to spot stretched downside.
tooltips.midline: Neutral baseline. Above = bullish bias; below = bearish.

presets.name: Momentum Bias
presets.teaser: Trade with the wind when momentum holds above neutral and builds.
presets.summary: Enter when RSI is above its midline and starting to rise. This signals positive momentum without extra filters.
presets.whyUnique: Clean, momentum-first bias without extra filters.

presets.name: Mean-Reversion Pop
presets.teaser: Catch the first lift after pressure eases from the lower zone.
presets.summary: Enter when RSI crosses up out of the oversold zone. This looks for a first bounce after a stretched move down.
presets.whyUnique: Pure reversion trigger that avoids mid-trend noise.

presets.name: Fade Exhaustion
presets.teaser: Step aside from stretch; look for momentum to cool from the top band.
presets.summary: Enter when RSI falls back below the overbought line. This looks for strength to ease after a stretch.
presets.whyUnique: Counter-move entry only once strength begins to ease.

presets.name: Trend Pullback Resume
presets.teaser: Align with an up-bias and let momentum re-engage.
presets.summary: Enter when price is above a simple moving average and RSI sits back above its midline and is rising. This combines trend bias with momentum confirmation.
presets.whyUnique: Adds a light trend gate for clarity in choppy tape.

presets.name: Midline Lift
presets.teaser: Simple reclaim of neutral into a fresh push.
presets.summary: Enter when RSI crosses up through the midline. A straightforward momentum turn without other conditions.
presets.whyUnique: Minimalist reclaim trigger with no additional filters.

presets.name: VWAP Momentum Filter
presets.teaser: Only engage when price leans with session bias and momentum aligns.
presets.summary: Enter when price is above VWAP and RSI is above the midline and rising. This prefers momentum that agrees with session bias.
presets.whyUnique: Combines session context with oscillator bias for clearer signals.

presets.name: Oversold Spring
presets.teaser: Pressure releases from the lower band, then momentum confirms.
presets.summary: Two steps: first RSI dips below the oversold line, then it crosses back above that line. Entry triggers on the reclaim.
presets.whyUnique: Two-stage confirmation helps filter weak bounces.

presets.name: Overbought Ease
presets.teaser: Stretch first, then loss of grip from the upper band.
presets.summary: Two steps: first RSI moves into the overbought zone, then it crosses back below that line. Entry triggers on the slip under.

presets.name: Reclaim Sequence
presets.teaser: Hold, shake, reclaim — a structured bias reset.
presets.summary: Three steps: RSI holds above the midline, briefly slips below it, then crosses back above. Entry triggers on the final reclaim.
presets.whyUnique: Three-event pattern that captures a classic reclaim setup.
